title: A word to people flaming you for being bad.
body:
From my game yesterday;

"I'm sorry I'm not better than my enemy laner. 
I'm sorry that my cs doesn't meet your standard. 
I'm sorry that I can't kite as you wish yet, or know how to ward and position most effectively. 

I'm only silver
And for all you need to know, I am trying to win this game just as much as you do. 
But your flaming and insulation doesn't make me play better.
I don't know what happened in your life to think this is a way to motivate people.
But it doesn't. So if you want to win, don't treat me as an enemy, because we're on the same side."

I know it's a little venty, but it keeps being so horribly annoying when your midlane flames the botlane or jungle to infinity. And yes, while muting is an option, it doesn't solve the problem.

Yesterday we had a game where I had a Lucian + Morgana completely stomping botlane, no matter what we tried, no matter how ahead I was on kill participation, he was just way better. The midlane brand and Jax jungle then made it their job to flame the hell out of me because I was dying so much.

The game before I was losing hard against a Lucian and Blitz crank botlane, and a nunu camping bot. I tried to farm to pull my way to late game, but their dive and pull potential/skill was just too big to play against. The midlane Annie was spamming "report my team" I'm all chat the entire game. 

Luckily through hard work and dedication, I pulled through and bought the items I needed, and recovered from the head start they head, eventually ending up winning both games. 

Proving a flamer wrong has never felt more satisfying than carrying the hell out of a game people complained about you throwing.

Though in the end, it's silver. Everyone knows that nobody there plays at lcs skill level. So it's stupid to even expect people would magically play on that skill level by insulting them for being bad.

But lane swapping is a rarity here unfortunately, because most people in this elo only focus/trick in one role.

A word to people under-performing in their role. 

I get it. I really do. 
We all have bad games. Sometimes we fail. 
Sometimes we roam into an enemy-infested bush and die.
Sometimes we tunnel too hard and don't see the map. 
I know this particular game doesn't define you as a player.
We don't ask for perfection. 

But please, if you die early:
Don't spam gg or ff.
Don't make excuses.
Don't flame your enemies.
Don't make enemies of your allies. 
Don't try and get some divine redemption by fighting the enemies that are stronger than you.
Don't afk push and let the enemies collapse and farm you. 
Don't refuse to fight when the team deems it necessary. 

When you start to fail, let the rest of the team hold your slack.
Become as light as a feather to carry. 
Farm under turret. 
Don't give your enemies the satisfaction of farming you. 
Get your satisfaction from ruining the enemies game. 
Make their game the most boring match ever by clearing waves under turret,
And pressuring their turret when they're roaming. 

You are not worthless. 
Buy wards. Go tanky. 
Focus on survival and objectives.
At full build, your champion will do its job
Regardless of how you performed early game.

actually farm is pretty simple, u could get 50 farm in lane at 10 minutes and end the game with 230 farm at 25 minutes. Just push out side lanes and farm jungle whenever you can, dont just follow your team around waiting for a skirmish, farm if their is nothing to do, better yet, farm mid for more mobility and utility when a teamfight happens nearby. I would reccomend taking 2 waves, then going into the jungle to take birds or krugs or wolves or gromp, then go top/bot and take 2 waves of cs from that. That can average you 12 - 14 cs per minute if u stay consistent with this strat ^

Maybe if you're mid or jgl, help them get a head start by roaming to bot, or tell them to play under turret, tell them to vision well if they have a stealthy jungler might they have died to junglers a lot.
